INDICATOR_NAME: Electricity production from renewable sources, excluding hydroelectric (kWh)
SOURCE_NOTE: Electricity production from renewable sources, excluding hydroelectric, includes geothermal, solar, tides, wind, biomass, and biofuels.

INDICATOR_NAME: Electricity production from oil sources (% of total)
SOURCE_NOTE: Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Oil refers to crude oil and petroleum products.

INDICATOR_NAME: Electricity production from nuclear sources (% of total)
SOURCE_NOTE: Sources of electricity refer to the inputs used to generate electricity. Nuclear power refers to electricity produced by nuclear power plants.

INDICATOR_NAME: Electric power transmission and distribution losses (% of output)
SOURCE_NOTE: Electric power transmission and distribution losses include losses in transmission between sources of supply and points of distribution and in the distribution to consumers, including pilferage.

INDICATOR_NAME: Access to electricity, urban (% of urban population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Access to electricity, urban is the percentage of urban population with access to electricity.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: World Bank Global Electrification Database from "Tracking SDG 7: The Energy Progress Report" led jointly by the custodian agencies: the International Energy Agency (IEA), the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA), the United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), the World Bank and the World Health Organization (WHO).

SOURCE_NOTE: Access to electricity is the percentage of population with access to electricity. Electrification data are collected from industry, national surveys and international sources.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: World Bank Global Electrification Database from "Tracking SDG 7: The Energy Progress Report" led jointly by the custodian agencies: the International Energy Agency (IEA), the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA), the United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), the World Bank and the World Health Organization (WHO).

INDICATOR_NAME: Access to electricity, rural (% of rural population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Access to electricity, rural is the percentage of rural population with access to electricity.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: World Bank Global Electrification Database from "Tracking SDG 7: The Energy Progress Report" led jointly by the custodian agencies: the International Energy Agency (IEA), the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA), the United Nations Statistics Division (UNSD), the World Bank and the World Health Organization (WHO).
